intro: Calycodaphne dysoxylon, commonly known as the broadleaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses and sedges. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland and riparian ecosystems.
